intro: Crepis ciliata, commonly known as the silky hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces bright yellow composite flowers that consist of ray florets and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Crepis ciliata is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and disturbed soils. It is a perennial plant that thrives in temperate climates and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
